the officer rode up, looked at the en- trenchment, and went on again. Just behind it they came upon some dozens of soldiers, con- tinually replaced by others, who ran from the entrenchment. They had to hold their noses 
and put their horses to a trot to escape from the poisoned atmosphere of these latrines. 
"Voild I'agrdment des camps, monsieur le prince" 
said the staff officer.
